case_vignette: A 68-year-old man comes to the physician 3 months after noticing skin changes on his scalp. When he scrapes off the crust of the lesion, it reappears after a few days. Occasionally, his scalp itches or he notices a burning sensation. He had a mole removed on his right forearm 5 years ago. He is a retired winemaker. His vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows multiple rough patches on his scalp. A photograph is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've noticed some changes on my scalp, including rough patches, and when I scrape off the crust, it comes back after a few days. Sometimes, my scalp itches or I feel a burning sensation.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for about 3 months.
Do you have similar symptoms on other parts of your body, or is it limited to your scalp?
It is limited to my scalp.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin conditions like psoriasis or eczema?
No, I do not have a history of skin conditions like psoriasis or eczema.
Have you used any new hair products or treatments recently before these symptoms started?
No, I have not used any new hair products or treatments recently before these symptoms started.
Are the patches you mentioned associated with hair loss in those areas?
The information about hair loss is not specified in my case.
Are the patches you mentioned scaly or oily in appearance?
The patches are rough, but the exact texture as scaly or oily is not specified.
Does exposure to sunlight or using topical ointments improve your symptoms at all?
I haven't noticed if sunlight exposure or topical ointments have any effect on my symptoms.
Have you noticed any improvement or change in your symptoms after using any specific shampoos or treatments?
I haven't noticed any improvement or change in my symptoms after using specific shampoos or treatments.
Final Diagnosis: Seborrheic Dermatitis
